author: potuz
content:
<@!273808422753796097> apologies if this is not the right channel to ask. I have two questions about the "incentive accounting reform" {{2140}}. First one is `FLAG_HEAD_AND_VERY_TIMELY` as in the description of the PR doesn't exist right? (probably this was changed in some commit, didn't check). The other one is regarding `TIMELY_HEAD_FLAG` that gets set in 
```
if is_matching_head and state.slot <= data.slot + MIN_ATTESTATION_INCLUSION_DELAY:
     participation_flags.append(TIMELY_HEAD_FLAG)
```
My issue with this is that its another place where a validator gets rewarded purely by luck and not by doing its job fine. Mainnet has been going great, voting is essentially perfect. There are two aspects that this proposed flag rewards for: head and timing. 
For head, currently essentially the only times we vote incorrectly now is when a block arrives late. This is fine to be penalized here, as there is no way of knowing if this is the validator's fault or the previous block proposer. This PR does not change behavior in this case. 
For inclusion distance however, voting is so great in mainnet that essentially all the times that we get inclusion distance more than 1 is because the next block is missing. We get a penalty but this penalty is minimal. This PR changes this behavior to all or nothing and this seems to me that is penalizing a validator when it's clearly not its fault.

author: .vbuterin
content: So the goal of combining the rewards into "AND" rewards is basically to have somewhat higher penalties for mediocre performance; with status quo rewards, it's possible for validators to be net-profitable even if they wait a minute before sending every attestation

author: potuz
content: Yes with this I completely agree, and I understand that it would be complicated/impossible to check if the next blocks were missing. Just wanted to point that the way mainnet is going now, this flag will mostly penalize validators that attested well but the next proposer failed
